intro: Eriogonum trinervatum, commonly known as the three-veined buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, small white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with three prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. Eriogonum trinervatum is often found in coastal and inland areas, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
